page.title: 01Land S W of Bratton Fleming
page.content: The area is split by many hills and valleys running down to Chelfham. The hilltops and flattish valley bottoms are mostly pasture with many mainly deciduous woods clinging to steeper hillsides. Farms are small,devoted principally to sheep, a few cows and some fattening of bullocks. Any crops grown are mostly for cattle feed. The movement of sheep flocks up and down main road freqently halts traffic. Chelfham Mill School for maladjusted boys, in the shadow of the old Lynton Railway viaduct, run a small mixed farm for training purposes. Lower Loxhore, an offshoot of Loxhore, and Stoke River with its mainly unrestored church are small hamlets.Journeys give oportunites for wildlife spotting. Herons along the river can be seen from the higher viewpoint of the bus. Wheeling buzzards are frequent
